title: AITA for not wanting my flatmate's best friend around my cat?
body: My flatmate's best friend came to me a couple times to tell me my cat is really pretty, really nice, really soft, all that tralala, but she recently learnt that he's going to the vet to get neutered next week and since then has started asking me to find a cat to breed him with before the operation so she can have one of his offspring, or to just straight up cancel the appointment so he can wander off and make babies. I told her I was not comfortable with that and thought that was gonna be the end of it, but since then she keeps asking me about it and I walked in on her forcefully holding my cat in my flatmate's room after I had told her I was looking for him and she had told me she didn't know where he was. I made it clear that I didn't want her around my cat anymore and now both my flatmate and her are making me out to be the asshole because she didn't do "anything dangerous". AITA? I don't want my cat to be traumatized and not let anyone hold or pet him because of her. I put a lot of time and effort into making him feel safe and she's acting like it's "just a cat".

body:

body: My company has sent me abroad for a week, and has given me $40 per day as a food allowance. Due to my eating habits, I only eat supper and drink water throughout the day. title: AITA for being upset with a grieving woman?
body:
I know that the title is kind of extreme. I don't know what else to call it. I just need to get this out. 


So almost a year ago, my aunt (let's call her Bella), lost her uncle (so my great uncle?). She was there as he took his final breath in the hospital. I know that it must have been so hard to watch, and I genuinely feel bad for her. 


This is the only thing that we relate to. This woman, even after I was diagnosed with severe depression because of this and offered counselling, scoffed and made petty insults, insisting that there's nothing wrong with me, and that it's time to move on. She is quick to throw out the word "baby" when she sees tears forming in my eyes, and gets upset when I seem to at all be bothered by this. That's fine. She wants me to move on so that I can feel better. Except no. 


Aunt Bella still has days where she gets really upset, requests to be left alone, or will just snap at me for no real reason. 


She kept some roses from his burial, and insists that she take care of them for as long as possible. The only issue is that she asks me to do it, and she herself hasn't touched them since the day we brought them home. That's fine, I guess, but she often gets really mad and accuses me of not watering/tending to the roses, calling me a liar and insisting that I'm trying to make a fool of her or purposely kill the plants. Last night was another such night, and it ended in me going for a walk and not coming back for hours because I knew that it would only continue the second I walked through the door. 


Now, I always prefer to just leave the situation instead of continue to argue, but she lives with us, and her husband, my uncle Caesar drives me around when I need to go somewhere because our schedules are the same. Either way, I'm always around them. Aside from that, I hate being called names, and she's already called me selfish and an addict this week because of my pill habits (that I'm genuinely trying to stop).


Caesar got mad at me today and called me selfish, rude, and a few other names because Bella had told him about last night and the roses. Again, name calling. He also decided to pile on the fact that I'm lazy or whatever because I was too tired from work and that walk to come take care of Bella's cat (whom I might be allergic to, and who hates me and leaves cuts all over me). 


Now, I really do want to forgive them and move on, but this happens so often now, and Bella is known to get angry and go on tangents like this. It's NOT just because of her uncle's passing. She and Caesar have always been this accusatory. 
But, at the end of the day, she is still grieving, and I really need to know if I'm being petty by getting upset over this. 


So, Reddit, AITA here? Should I just forgive them already?

title: AITA for refusing to pay back my sister the rest of the money I stole from her because she’s now married to a super rich man?
body:
Back when I was using, I stole a couple hundred dollars from my sister. I’m not proud of it and have tried my best to repay her back. 

I’ve currently been sober for a year. 

Recently, my sister got married to a very wealthy man. Since then, she hasn’t wanted for anything. I’m happy for her. 

Since she got married though, I’ve sort of slowed down how much I’ve been paying her back and I haven’t sent her any money in a couple weeks. She has so much money now that anything I could ever give her wouldn’t matter and paying her back honestly makes me even more broke than I already am and I need every penny I can get. 

My sister was over at my house this week helping me just clean and get my stuff together (I’ve recently moved). 

At one point, while we took a break, she turns to me and asks me when I’m going to give her the rest of the money I owe her. 

I kind of looked at her incredulously and said that she couldn’t really expect me to pay her back when she now has so much money already. 

She got pissed at me and said that it was the money I owed her and that I need to pay her back. I told her she was being greedy and that she had enough money. 

She told me I was still acting like her junkie thief brother and left my place after that. 

She won’t respond to my calls or texts asking her to meet up with me and talk about it since then. 

I worked so hard getting myself to the point I’m at and I have so little money already and she had so much, that I don’t really know if I actually am the asshole for not wanting to pay her back. 

AITA?

title: AITA for refusing to believe my brother was being bullied?
body:
My brother lives with my mother and she spends most of her time working. I don't live in the same city as them so I can't be around as much as I would want to but through out the year I have been getting calls from my mother saying my brother's school work was slipping, that he spends all his time playing video games. He tells me that she is over exaggerating and he does not play as much as she says. When I do go around to visit, he spends 95% of his time staying up till 3+ am on his xbox playing shooters talking with friends over headset. Through out the school year, I started getting calls saying he was skipping classes, he would stay up too late playing games, When I call to talk to him about it, he would argue it was because he didn't have classes on those days. I try to encourage to go to bed at a sensible time and still use time away from class to study because we don't want him to fail his exams, he says he will and he has the exams in the bag, he studies the materials and knows the content very well.

This cycle continues for a few months where he starts talking about not liking the college because he is more interested in doing an Apprenticeship rather than going the degree route. So then unto 2 weeks ago, I get a call from my mother saying he failed all of his exams including 1 paper where he turned up late to it and another where he didn't turn up at all. I call him to ask him "wtf?!" He said he turned up late to the paper just because he accidentally over slept and missed the other one because no one told him he had a paper on that day.

I immediately called BS on the latter one because no school of any kind would not tell their students weeks if not months in advance that you have an exam scheduled for X date. It's then he tells me that he avoided going to class because he was being bullied.

I ask him why wait till now to mention it, he says he doesn't know but it had been going on for most of the school year, that is why he was avoiding going to class. He didn't tell anyone because he was too afraid.

I ask how many were there. He says 4...no 5- actually 6. This is the part that confused me. In my opinion, If there were people bulling you for nearly a year continuously, you would instantly know how many there are and their names.

I ask if he spoke to other students about it and he says no because he doesn't have any friends. I struggled to believe this because I remembered him talking about a friend he had in class and how he and said friend tried to organise a class trip to a convention a few months earlier (Which he failed to go to because once again, no one told him about needing a permission slip and money to go on a trip he was meant to  have planned.)

With all the evidence in front of me, I point blank said I didn't believe the bullying story and this is all just an excuse to hand wave him failing all his exams.

AITA if I won't bring my overweight father snacks while he's on a diet
body: My dad is always in one of two stages; on a strict diet like keto, or have a 'cheat day', which usually lasts a few weeks till he returns to the intense diet. He's not obese, only overweight, probably due to alcohol consumption in his early 20s-30s, poor eating habits, and lack of exercise after having kids. The thing about these crash diets he uses, is they're pretty unsustainable and if you cheat at all, your progress halts or even reverts. He asks me to bring him snacks like oreo's, chips ahoy, etc. He gets angry at me when I tell him no, and justifies the treat by saying he's lost weight, or he's had a long day. I think this is a little hypocritical as he criticizes me for associating food with mood, or rewards, and tells me I have a poor relationship with food.  I've tried to get him on a more regular diet that focuses on eating healthy amounts of all food groups and exercising regularly, but he insists on these intense diets. I feel bad because he does work hard, and I don't enjoy being punished for not bringing him snacks, so AITA?

AITA for not changing beard or wearing glasses just because I somewhat look like the groom at wedding?
body:
Long time lurker... first post yay

So, a close family member is getting married soon. I have been told to either grow my beard out a lot, or shave it completely for the wedding. Or the option of wearing glasses that I only use while looking at classroom boards from far away, while sitting. The moment before I stand to walk around, I remove my glasses. I only use them in the classroom while sitting.

I have been told to do this as their "wedding present". Also because a very old family member recently mistook the groom for myself. I have not seen this family member for a long time. I live several hours away from most of the family anyway. I don't see them too often, but will during the wedding. I am a member of the groomsmen. I don't feel it is okay to strongly request this, to the point of being overly upset if I choose to not follow their request. A request can be denied, and I am choosing to have a cleanly shaped beard, and not wear glasses that will make me nearly blind while walking around. I don't think I look too similar to the soon to be married groom. We look similar, but its quite easy to tell us apart. I don't feel its my issue to change my appearance for the wedding just because of a similarity. I find it upsetting that I am told to change my appearance because of their choice to marry a person that may look similar and not my choice that we do have a slight resemblance.

Edit: The close family member is my sister by the way. Also 1 parent seems quite upset that I am not going to follow their request, saying its a simple thing to do for them. Which yea, it is simple to do, yet I may be stubborn in my decision, but feels wrong to change my looks and fake on my part. And the other parent seems to completely agree with my decision.



I view it as altering my normal appearance to make the bride feel better about her insecurities. I am her brother, and being asked to cover up my looks so I am "different". Seems crazy to me. But in using these fake glasses, this will prevent several people from freaking out on me. I don't think it's a big deal at all if I look somewhat alike to the groom. Similarity is minor. Just 2 dudes with beards and same color hair.

Also, as many have suggested, I tried to step down from the wedding party. But that was also not allowed as I was told I have already accepted the responsibility of being a groomsmen and with it comes the responsibility of changing my appearance in this way.

Also as mentioned, I am not able to just simply not go as well. This would also upset the same people in the exact same manner and cause a potentially irreversible issue within the family...

title: AITA for not wanting my boyfriend to publicly react to lingerie pics on Facebook?
body:
Basically the title. I get it, this is such a basic millennial thing to even have an issue with. My boyfriend follows some lingerie models on Facebook and heart reacts to their posts, meaning that due to the way Facebook works, the post and the fact that he reacted to it comes up on his friends (and my) timeline.

We have just reached the point in our relationship where he is starting to get to know my friends and we had even recently discussed him adding my mum on Facebook but I’m not exactly keen for her to be made aware that he likes thicc women and is unafraid to share this with the world.

When I brought it up with him, he was adamant that it’s “just content” and that he isn’t trying to start an interaction - he just reacts to it and then scrolls on. I think personally that if you’re not trying to start an interaction it’s easy enough to just look at the pic or save it. 

I’m a pretty chill person about this kind of stuff - I know we both have reddit porn accounts, follow hot people on social media, it’s totally ok in our relationship to bring up how attractive other people are, etc. I just draw the line at him reacting to that content on Facebook where people we know in real life (and people I want to get a good impression of him, because I really like this guy) can see it.

Now I’m starting to doubt myself and wonder if I’m being unreasonable for being upset over this.

EDIT: he sent me a message along the lines of “I wouldn’t be upset if you did that, I didn’t think it was that bad, I won’t do it again” but I still don’t agree that it is just like reacting to any other content

title: WIBTA for taking down a negative Amazon review in exchange for a 30 dollar gift card?
body:
I bought a nail lamp on Amazon that claimed to be an LED lamp when it was in fact either a UV or combination lamp.  (For background just in case it's necessary, nail lamps cure gel polish, there are lamps that cure both, or just either.)  I do not like UV lamps because of the negative side effects (re: black nail beds, UV ray damage).  UV lamps also take double the time or more to cure polish vs LED, but tbh that's not something I particularly care about in light of all the other reasons that I think that UV lamps are bad.

After trying to use the lamp, I realized that the listing was misleading and the lamp was not, in fact, an LED only lamp, which I guess it's my own fault for buying a cheap lamp on Amazon for 15 dollars instead of a real lamp from a beauty supplier for like 70, but I'm a student and I'm cheap.  I left a negative review, letting people know that the lamp was not advertised, and I returned the item.

The company just emailed me and asked me to take my review down in exchange for a 30 dollar Amazon gift card.  Would I be an asshole if I take the money?

​

Edit: changed "finger beds" to "nail beds" to be more clear.

title: AITA for getting snippy with my co-worker?
body:
Hello,

I started working with my company a year ago and everything has been great except my co-worker. For some background info. We work in Japan and there are only 3 workers (myself, my coworker, and my boss). My boss is great and his wife also works with us. She is incredible. My co-worker on the other hand is, for lack of better words, a handful. She is a generally kind woman, but complains excessively.

I left my home country to get away from my negative family, be with my SO, and take a step toward the career I want. I love my job, but I've started to get genuine anxiety anytime I go into work because I know the second I walk in the door she will be attached to my heels. I can set up in a different room and she will move her things to sit with me. I can stand in a corner and she will block me in the corner. I can remove all chairs from the room (as I have to anyway) and she will stand in the room and stare at me/complain even though there are 3 other rooms that are available (I plan my lessons in the room I'm assigned to).

The other day she was being her typical, negative self and was planning classes. Our planning books have the numbers hand written because they were sent without them in it. She noticed that the pages were labeled wrong and threw a bit of a fit. The conversation went as follows

Her: the pages numbers are wrong

Me: oh, that looks like my handwriting. I'm sorry. I would have fixed it if I noticed *continues to do my work*

She gets huffy and throws the book down on the table "well, I guess I'm not planning my classes then"

Me: or you could fix the pages and do your job.

I realize I was a bit mean, but if she makes mistakes and I notice, I fix them. That is what is expected of us. It has always been expected of us. It is important to note that she has been at the job for 10 years. Because of her behavior for the past year (according to my boss) she is not being recontracted.  I told my boss what happened and he said he was glad I stood up to her, but I still feel bad primarily because of how shocked she looked. I'm not typically one to talk back or get snippy, but I've had enough.

AITA?

I don't give anyone permission to put on YouTube or use this in any other manner.

title: WIBTA if I gave my parents a (nice, framed) "family photo" of myself, my partner and my dog for Xmas?
body:
My parents are really hard to buy for. My mum has really eclectic taste and my dad is a rich ol boomer who has already bought himself everything he wants and generally doesn't like gifts, but will still get sad if you don't get him something. I'm going to be home for Christmas for the first time in 3 years and I'm really stuck on what to get them. It needs to fit in my luggage but be thoughtful because i havent seen them in ages.

My partner and I paid way too much money to get some really nice professional photos done with us and our dog. They're fun photos, not stuffy or awkward. I only see my parents once a year so I was thinking it might be a nice gift, especially for my dad who doesnt have social media so doesn't see any of our updates or photos. but part of me thinks it's a bit weird to give someone a photo of yourself and that they might think I was being cheap or something?

title: AITA for not switching off a horror movie that was scaring my friend's GF?
body:
Okay so this is my newly made alt account for horror and food stuff so forgive me if I'm not fantastic at replying to comments and stuff.

This is basically exactly what the title says. My best friend has been going out with this girl for a little bit more than six months. Her behaviour is...well, I can't determine whether she's seriously possessive or just has massive FOMO, but she gets super pouty and kinda cranky if he does anything without her. Most of thr time I don't mind her tagging along to things, she can honestly be really good fun. There are two exceptions however: the first is nights out, because she always gets super obnoxiously drunk and usually ends up getting us kicked out of places/needing taken care of all evening. The second is movie night.

My friend and I have a longstanding tradition of getting together once a week and watching movies. Specifically, we love horror movies, the spookier the better. Generally we do this on a Sunday night, when his gf gets dinner and goes to a spin class with her sister. She's very much *not* into horror movies and actually watches almost exclusively kids movies, Disney and the like (nothing wrong with that but it is relevant here to mention). That's why we do it when she's busy; she won't be upset at being left out and we can watch the movies we enjoy. Last night, however, her sister was sick and her class was cancelled. She insisted on joining us for movie night. We had originally planned to watch a horror film called The Ritual which has been on our list for quite a while, and I asked what we were gonna watch instead. The gf insisted that we could still watch The Ritual, that she wasn't a pussy and "come on it's a film how scary can it be." 

Turns out, the answer is quite scary. The gf spent most it hiding behind her sweater and shrieking/screaming. Apparently, after they went home, she couldn't  sleep because she was so terrified and she actually cried out of fear several times throughout the night. She's pinning this as my fault and is really angry with me, insisting that I should've known she'd be scared (I did, that's why I asked if we were watching something else) and that I ought to have switched it off the second I noticed how frightened she was. My mate is on her side because duh, she's his GF. My counter to this is a) *she* insisted she'd be fine and we should still watch it, even after I offered to watch something else and b) my friend and I were thoroughly enjoying this movie we'd waited a long time to watch. I'm aware that the latter reason is rather selfish, but it is what it is. I do feel bad that she was so frightened, but I don't see how I'm responsible or how she's in anyway justified in being so pissed off at me. Am I a knob for this or am I right that I did nothing wrong?

title: AITA for refusing to take an elderly man’s blood sugar when it’s not part of my job?
body:
I recently started a new job as a caregiver. I was told I would be sitting with an elderly man with severe depression and that was his only issue. 


This isn’t true, he has many issues. Mostly Nonverbal, doesn’t walk. I like being with him a lot though, he’s a cool dude. He gives me thumbs up when he’s all good and even will say “cigarette” when needed. He’s got the important words down at least. 

My first day I was asked by his wife if I would take his vitals and blood sugar and give him insulin if needed. I said I wasn’t sure how but I’d be willing to learn. After talking to my supervisor I am strictly forbidden from doing that. I am not home health. I am not even allowed to give him a dose of cough medicine or a vitamin. It’s company policy. 

Today I was asked by his wife if I wanted to learn to do blood sugar. I told her what my supervisor said. She launched into this huge rant that included things like “do they just hire anyone on the street who can pass a drug test?” (Yes basically) “how do you know if you’re suppose to call 911” (I don’t know. I didn’t make the rules. I just follow them) “all the other aids did it!” (All the other aids could’ve killed him giving his insulin when they didn’t know how, apparently) “you said you’d do it the first day!”(that’s before I knew it was illegal)  She eventually said she wasn’t mad at me, just mad at the policy. 

She has a good point with the 911 thing. That’s why I think I may be the asshole. I’ll ask my supervisor about that Monday morning. But I don’t think she’s suddenly gonna let me take his blood sugar and administer insulin. 

Tl;dr. Told my patient I’d cover blood sugar and insulin. Then found out my job position won’t allow it. AITA?

title: AITA For Thinking She's Unreasonable and Controlling?
body:
My SO and I moved into a new apartment in April. We have 2 roommates, a 60- year old woman and a man in his 40s or early 50s. He is a recovering alcoholic and goes to AA meetings everyday. The man and i have talked about his recovery multiple times. He has a sponsor and is a sponsor himself to about 4 people.

Yesterday my SO came home from work after having a couple beers with a friend. I found an empty beer bottle in his lunch box and threw it away. No issues. This morning I get called out of my room by the woman (her name is the only one on the lease; we moved in with her) and told "ya know [man] is in AA and you can't be having that alcohol in here." I told her what happened- didn't drink here, just threw it away- and she keeps arguing with me about it like "I'm not trying to control you (yes she is; major control freak) but you have to think about everyone else in the house."

I replied, "I'm just a little frustrated because we've had alcohol in the fridge a couple of times before- once you even asked me what I was drinking/how it tasted/etc, and you never said anything." She says, "yeah well I just never had the chance." Not believing her, I asked if I should give her an extra $20 a month in rent and I could get a mini fridge in our room and she said no because "we don't have to take it there. I don't care if you drink or whatever but it ruins too many lives. You know [Man] is in recovery and my sisters both drink like fishes." (I didn't know this until right now.) 

I ended up just being like "So what do you want us to do? you say we're allowed to drink or whatever but you don't want it in your house and you don't wanna be involved in it? What are the options then?" and she was like "whatever you want to do." Like, if it really was "whatever I wanted" I'd be able to keep a 6 pack on my shelf in the fridge...

title: AITA because I declined a (pretty much) all expenses paid vacation to CA from my (very sweet) inlaws because I am so deathly afraid of sharks?
body:
Using a throwaway since I lurk and occasionally comment on this sub from my regular account and based on all my past "YTA" votes i'm probably being a massive hypocrite. 

I was born and raised as far away from any sort of coast as you can possibly be in the US. I've been to the ocean one time in Florida when I was little and all I can remember is thinking that something down there is going to eat me. 

I hit the lottery when it comes to inlaws. The are the sweetest people on the planet, they are amazing grandparents (contrary to so many of the stories I read on reddit) and they treat me as well as the do my husband's sisters. I love them so much. 

My FIL is a really high ranking retired Navy officer and one of his favorite subordinates is retiring  in August. My inlaws have come up with a plan to cash in some stock, rent a beach house for two weeks and take their entire family on vacation to coordinate with the retirement ceremony. They are paying for all lodging, ask that we provide food and cook from time to time and they are paying for our kids' airline tickets (we would use my husbands miles for our tickets). It's insanely generous. 

With all that I said no. I physically can't go on a vacation where my kids are right next to the ocean. It just can't happen. They are good swimmers but so much could happen like the beaches are crowded and they get taken away, they wander into a riptide, they get hurt on the boardwalk and on and on. But mostly I am so freaking scared of sharks that I can't let me or my family go. I just can't. I know this might be irrational but it's not unrealistic. I just read a story of a triathlete getting eaten by a shark on a beach just miles north of where this beach house would be. It does happen. 

My kids are heartbroken, my husband is trying to be nice and not make fun of me but I know he's thinking "why did I marry this crazy woman again?" My inlaws are so disappointed because it would have been the very first time they would have had all their children and grandchildren in one location. My MIL is being so sweet to try to talk me into it but I just can't do it. 

AITA?

Edit: I just talked with my MIL and you guys are all correct and we are going to go. But my hands were trembling as I made the call. This isn't easy for me.

title: AITA for shouting/swearing back at my parents after a beating?
body:
I am Indian, so beating up kids is not a big deal here. I have always been beat up since I was very young and have always been used to it. 

For context: I am not an academically gifted person, I barely make through exams. 

Today, my father came back from work and shortly after started taunting me, telling me how useless of a person I am,  how I won't be able to achieve much in life. This went on for a while, so now I'm irritated and so I go to my room, lock it and just calm down. So my father comes, starts banging the door hard and tells me to open up, so I did. Now, he comes in and slaps me around a bit, and leaves. Comes in with a screwdriver and starts removing the lock on the door. Then, he goes into a rage again, and comes towards me to beat me, again, so I instinctively hold his hand, so he hits me with the screwdriver instead, from the grip side, not the head. This may or may not have been intentional, I doubt it was. Anyway, I enter rage mode myself, push him back and start swearing/screaming, more of swearing. This goes on for a few minutes until things calmed down.

TL:DR - Father hit me with a screwdriver, I scream and swear at him. AITA?

title: WIBTA if I didn't bring my boyfriend to "girls day out"?
body:
Okay, so my boyfriend is extremely popular and everyone who meets him pretty much likes him. So much so that my friends force me to bring him with me when they do things because according to them, "he carries the night and makes everything fun". Since he's my boyfriend and I LOVE hanging out with him every second I can, I have no problem inviting him along with me. However, my friends want to have a "just girls day out" at the mall tomorrow.

I agreed of course because I thought it would be nice, but today I woke up to this text from the group chat, "hey \[Ready-Cod\], please invite \[boyfriend's name\] to come to the mall with us tomorrow". I was confused and asked why because I thought it was only going to be us girls. But then they said, "it is we arent bringing our bfs, but the thing is that yours is sm more fun and we really need him to come cause he has a lot of energy".

Of course I would have no problem with this typically, but my friends aren't inviting their boyfriends and I think that's kind of rude. I'm glad they really love being around my boyfriend as much as me, but I don't think it's fair that theirs don't also get to come because they pretty much implied their own boyfriends are boring and lame.

I told them no for this reason, and then suddenly three people "couldn't make it". It was clear that they cancelled when they heard I wouldn't be inviting my boyfriend. Now they're being really passive aggressive towards me and I don't know, now I'm starting to think fuck it I'll just bring my boyfriend if that's what they want. But I don't know, I need unbiased opinions, WIBTA if I didn't bring him?

title: WIBTA if I quit my new job?
body:
I'm desperately just trying to Deal, but I've only been here three weeks and payroll continues to be a huge issue. Ever since day one I've had issues with how things seem to be run.

The management is bonkers about how they do things, such as having a system that allows you to receipt invoices for stock but never receipting them so absolutely everything is out, and insisting that orders are filed physically despite an electronic inventory that would trigger backorder notifications in the system they used to process it if that stock were recepited in! I feel like I know their system better than they do, but despite pointing out my issues, they keep shifting the blame for these methods onto someone else within the company and refusing to allow anyone to do them.

I had to go pressing and asking to find out simple things like my retail level so I can find out my pay grade, shit that I should have been told when signing on. I recieved no formal training for how their systems are run (I know their program, but it's laid out and named differently and some processes are wildly different for no reason), and I'm being expected to do tasks outside of my pay grade, something now ex-staff had warned me early about.

I didn't even know they'd officially hired me! They told me to come in for a trial shift and then I was rostered on for the rest of the month! I was asked for my bank details but the employer/payroll officer provided none of the finer paperwork for my payroll to be processed for tax, and didn't bring it up until a solid two weeks later.

I'm only a casual but I'm working near full-time hours when I was promised lunch cover shifts, and any request to have a day off has been met with being given a full day shift on the one day off I had. Maybe a few months from now I wouldn't mind, but at this point in time I physically cannot handle so many long shifts when I was initially promised 'maybe up to 17 hours a week'. Later on it wouldn't be so bad, but right now it's a struggle.

My last job only lasted seven weeks (fulltime, emotional breakdown due to stress, thus me wanting the casual position). I feel like that experience could be making me take all of this out of proportion. I want to at least try and find a new job this time before cutting ties but I actually do not know if I'll be fired before then thanks to some staff who told me their experiences.

Would I be the asshole if I quit?

title: AITA for refusing to buy my daughter expensive name brand shoes for Christmas & telling my husband to return the pair he bought?
body:
My 15-year-old daughter Kelly has been begging me for months for a pair of Dr. Martens. She wants a pair of the leather ones, despite knowing that I run a vegan household and I refuse to buy leather. We have been SERIOUSLY arguing about it. She said fine, buy her a pair of the “pleather” ones as she described it, and I told her that I wouldn’t be getting a pair of fancy name brand boots made out of vegan leather when there are plenty of other man-made black boots she could get at DWR for $50. She doesn’t want that’s of course, she wants the boots her friends are wearing, and she argues that the ones she gets at DWR are cheap and fall apart in a year. She’s incredibly rough on her boots, constantly stepping in water and mud and snow and scuffing them, and she acts like it’s the fault of the boots for getting beaten up. Her much desired leather Dr. Martens won’t stand up any differently.

I thought we were done with this but she went behind my back to my husband. He came up to me and had the boots that she’d asked for, saying that it was Christmas, it was within the budget for presents we’d purchased for her siblings. He knows it’s not about that. I was furious and told him to return them, he said he’d already shown them to her and she was excited, I told him that he gets to be the one to break the news to her since he was the one who screwed up. He’s mad at me now, called me a “tyrant.”

AITA for not wanting to get her these expensive boots and being a “tyrant”? I am happy to buy her a nice pair of the man-made materials boots, she could get three pairs for the price of the name brand ones!

title: AITA for parking in a loading zone while unloading my son for class?
body:
First, glad to be able to participate. I was banned for drunk posting something stupid late one night. Thankfully, I was recently unbanned. Staying away from the sauce for multiple reasons. On to the question:

My wife and I enrolled our 4 year old son in art classes at the local art museum for the summer. I drop him off in the morning, and have trouble finding parking as the museum neighbors the zoo which is in high gear. Often, I have to park far away and trudge in with my son and carrying his little brother. There is no sidewalk in this parking lot so often we are walking across the lawn of the park which separates the museum and zoo. I noticed parents parking temporarily in the yellow loading zone, one of those ones with striped yellow lines that are next to the handicapped parking and parallel the sidewalk that curves around the parking lot driveway. [Edit - there is no signs in this zone] They park there, walk in with their kids, and then walk out and drive away. It probably takes 5 minutes altogether.

One morning, I decided to do the same and parked behind a parents vehicle that was already there, as I had seen others do. I noticed a man who I thought was a parent loitering around the vehicle in front of me, that I thought was his, and looking at it in an annoyed way. I waved at him as I brought my son to his class. 

On my way out, the same man drove by (don't know if this is relevant, but in a nice white convertible) my (old beat up) truck and yelled at me that I was being inconsiderate parking there. I took his point to be that I was blocking traffic, which we weren't as we were in the loading zone and cars could pass us by. 

I shouted back "Thank you, have a nice day" probably a little sarcastic. He stopped his vehicle in the middle of the road, which was definitely blocking traffic, and we got into a little bit of a verbal altercation. 

It never approached anything physical, although he did call me a punk and said I was lucky he didn't get out of his car. Now, I was definitely the asshole by replying "really, let me put my boys down". You don't have to tell me I was an asshole for even thinking for a second about letting it get physical in front of my boys. And I was probably an asshole for even getting into an argument with him in front of them in the first place. In my defense, all my responses were polite while probably on the sarcastic side. He said he was going to call the police, I replied "did you need their help?", he called me entitled and drove away. I haven't seen him since. 

I regret my participation in the argument, but should I regret parking there? 

TLDR: AITA for parking in the museum loading zone just long enough to walk my 4 year old son into the museum for his class?

title: AITA for taking back my gaming account and deactivate it after giving it to my friend who tried to sell it?
body:
Me and a friend had been playing a MMO game(don't ask) for a long time, a very much pay-to-win type of game. I have spent many thousands(probably more) on my account to keep it's attributes and power to be among the strongest ones in the sever we were in(top 10, in fact). 


About a week ago I suddenly lost the will to play it, finding it just an addiction, a waste of time and money and the reason I was still attached to it was because of my Alliance mates. I wanted to go back to the real world and quit the game for good. I gave my account to my friend, as he still plays and my account would be of a great help to him and our Alliance. I made it clear to him that I would not play again.


I got a message earlier from another friend from the game that my friend had been trying to sell my account off for money. I immediately confronted my friend about it and he admitted it was true. He said that since I gave the account to him he thought he could sell it off, saying that the highest bidder so far offered him 1100 and he would split it with me.


The idea did not sit well with me. I gave the account to him so that he could take over my account to continue forward with our other friends so not to waste my money and effort building it. In anger, I logged into my account(thank god still binded with me), unbind it from my email and then uninstalled the game. This deactivated my account.


My friend had been calling me AH for doing so because it could have gotten some cash since I quit, and by deactivating it the account could no longer be used by anyone anymore, a no win situation. I think that well, at least it won't be given to anyone else and I can finally quit the game addiction for good. My account would still stay in the leaderboard till more people surppress it, and its character would be permanently standing on the far end of the map never moving again. AITA?

title: AITA for yelling at another persons child?
body:
Here’s a little bit of information before I tell you what happened. I do professional photography and I specialize in photographing animals. I have a membership to my local zoo so that I can go as much as I want to take pictures. I’m normally very polite and when people ask me questions about my camera or what I’m doing ,I normally answer their questions and give n them my information in case they want to hire me for a photoshoot. I bought a brand new $1600 lens for my camera and really wanted to test it out at the zoo so I had gone by meld to go take some pictures. 

The day started pretty normal with me taking pictures and talking to people who asked me questions about my camera. It was later in the day when a ton of school busses pulled up and dropped off about 20 school field trips. I don’t normally mind kids and in fact sometimes I’ll even let them see my pictures in the camera but there was one kid who I met who was just the worst. I was in the primate exhibit looking at some monkeys off of a balcony that was high off the ground and to take the pictures I was leaning over the railing with my camera. This child and his group had come up to the balcony to watch the monkeys play but was getting a little too excited. He bumped my camera a couple of times which I brushed off as him being young and only paying attention to the monkeys. I decided to move on to the monkeys next to the group so that I wouldn’t have to worry about anybody accidentally bumping my camera. After about five minutes of taking pictures the same child who was bumping me came back over to ask me about my camera. I was being nice to him and we enjoyed talking until he asked to hold the camera. My camera isn’t light and I didn’t want him to drop it on accident so I simply told him “I’m sorry but I can’t let you hold it.” The kid started to throw a tantrum and kept asking me if he could hold it and I kept telling him no, He then tried to hit the camera out of my hands over the balcony. I went over and told the adults in his group what the child was doing and they apologized for his behavior and sent him to go sit by himself for a while. I resumed taking pictures as normal and brushed off the kid until he came back up to me and pushed the camera out of my hands, The only thing that kept it from falling was the neck strap I had on. I was furious at the child for what he did and started to yell at him for almost destroying my camera. The parents of the group came over and asked me what happened. I told them that the kid had knocked out my camera from my hands and almost broke it. They said they were sorry and took the child away before I could do anything. 

Was the yelling too much or do y’all think it was well deserved?

title: WIBTA for disputing a credit card transaction over 30 cents?
body:
Using a throwaway for reasons.

Title basically says it all. There’s a food truck I go to a lot. All the sandwiches there are $5.50. I almost always pay in cash and tip. Today I didn’t have cash on me so I had to pay with credit card. They charge a 3% credit card fee. When I looked at my statement I realized they charged me $5.98 which is about 30 cents more than the $5.50 plus 3%. 

I don’t really care about the 30 cents but I don’t like feeling like I got ripped off. I normally give them more than the $5.98 after tip anyways but I feel like they basically took money from me without my permission. There was no option to tip. I live in a state with no sales tax and I just can’t think of any plausible way the total should be $5.98. It’s usually pretty busy there so I bet if they added 30 cents to every credit card transaction it could add up to around $100 a week. But I also realize it’s an insanely small amount of money and I feel kind of bad about reporting it. I’m sure if I sent pictures of the menu board and the 3% sign my credit card company would reimburse it. 

tldr; got overcharged by 30 cents considering reporting it but I feel bad

title: AITA for getting involved in a public dispute?
body:
Recently, me and a good friend of mine was eating sushi at a small restaurant in a shopping mall. We are enjoying our meal and because we live close by, we know the staff members on sight. It is a family restaurant run by Russian immigrants. 

As we were eating our sushi, the woman at the table next to us waved to the owner of the restaurant and started complaining about the sushi. The owner has a hard time with Swedish, but was gesturing apologetically to the woman. After thirty seconds of back and forth between them which had the woman complaining about the size of the sushi pieces and the price of the sushi with the owner trying to give her compensation in form of more sushi.

For some context; the sushi pieces are small, but not outrageously, in my opinion. The price is pretty good as far as sushi restaurants are concerned. This woman keeps raising her voice and is making it very clear that she will not accept any form of compensation, and tells him that she will never go to his establishment again and spread a post on Facebook about his sushi pieces.

At this point I’m pretty pissed off. I turned to her and ask her if she has any resemblance of shame in her body. She was genuinely shocked, and simply told me to mind my own business. However, I persisted and we had a loud discussion in that sushi restaurant about etiquette and the way you treat people. I am of course a teenager and she was not shy to bring up how out of my place I was and how I should respect my elders and their complaints. (The hag was in her 60s.) 

I feel like she might have a point about me stepping in where I don’t belong, and being an asshole to a woman who had a reasonable complaint about the sushi, but at the same time she repeatedly refused compensation and interrupted the owner as he tried to ask about the taste and service.

Am I the Asshole for stepping into this rant and turning it into a heated argument?

title: AITA for "ghosting" my friend?
body:
**TLDR;** My friend is upset that I'm applying for jobs in another country (to move with my boyfriend). She sent me a very petty message, and instead of replying, I blocked her from messaging me on FB.

​

**Some background:** My friend has always been very possessive of my time and attention. Generally not an issue since I can also be a very dependent person, but it regularly comes back to bite me in the ass when I hang out with other people over her, or if I'm in a relationship. She actively tries to get me to break up with people and has admitted that she has never been happy to see me or any of her other friends in relationships because it means she'll be alone. There are some pretty severe jealousy issues at play, and we've gotten around most of them by just...not talking about my relationships.

​

That being said, she is aware that my boyfriend and I would like to leave the country. Permanently. It's a very slow work-in-progress/pipe-dream, and I adopted it after meeting my boyfriend because honestly...it sounds great. It was very out of character for her, but she was supportive when I told her. I could tell she was being careful not to say anything unkind and genuinely trying to see the good points in this move and I appreciated it with all of my heart. While I hate how possessive she can be, I understand that it's something she's aware of and battling.

​

**The situation:** Recently, she referred me to her workplace. She knows it makes me uncomfortable since her office is insanely social, but we talked it out and decided that I needed the money and could handle some social awkwardness for the sake of my rent and bills. I've just been offered the job, and accepted it. I let her know that I was also interviewing and applying at other places that fit my needs a bit better and she seemed chill about it. Understood how pay and commute were important deciding factors for me, yadda yadda. But then I told her I was applying to a job in another country:

​

***Me***: I'm gonna apply to this amazing job overseas.

***Her***: Oh cool! Too bad you're too poor to make that move.

***Me***: If they sponsor me, I could get help with that. Admittedly, odds are slim.

***Her***: Yeah. And you shouldn't move until your health is in order.

***Me***: ??? My health is fine. I'm diagnosed and medicated. Other countries have doctors too.

***Her***: It'll still take a long time to see someone. It's better to wait to move until you've figured it out.

***Me***: I don't have weird meds. I can get a couple months filled to hold me over if I need to. Or even go without meds for a minute. I'll be okay.

***Her***: Okay, good luck!

***Me***: Thanks, I'm excited!

***Her***: Who knows. Maybe you'll get it and you'll be able to leave and take your boyfriend with you and give him the life he's always dreamed of. Sounds neat. I'm working so ttyl.

​

I was fuming, so I blocked her from messaging me on FB. I didn't outright block her profile and she can still hit me up over text or other social media. It took her several days to even realize she was blocked and she continued to send me texts without me responding. I finally answered to let her know I needed space and she says something to the tune of "It's okay if you need space, just don't ghost me." That pissed me off even more tbh. We clearly both wanted space, but as soon as she's done wallowing, I'm expected to just be open and available? Grahhh.

I can't help but see this all as selfish behavior on her part, and I don't regret blocking her the way I did. But...AITA for that?

​

title: AITA because of a freaking cat?!
body:
AITA for keeping the 16 year old cat downstairs because she pees on everything and doesn’t even like people.

My husband has taken care of a feral cat since she was five. She is sweet, but she is a little off. Overall, she doesn’t like people. She will come out and snuggle with you when It is very quiet and you are typically laying on the couch relaxing. The problem is that when you are not home, she comes out and lays on all of the furniture and pees on it. We have taken her to the vet several times and spent thousands of dollars on her. There isn’t a  medical solution, she is incontinent. 

For the most part, she likes to be alone. My husband feels guilty that she is alone downstairs. But I contend that she has food and a safe space to live in a controlled setting where if she pees on something, that it isn’t a big deal. He is upset that I don’t go and spend more time with her downstairs to interact. I admit that I don’t do what I should,  but my husband doesn’t either, and his reasoning for not going down there is that “there isn’t anything to do down there”.   I told my husband that she is fine to come upstairs and be allowed to Rome around, if I can replace anything she ruins that she pees on. He then argues that I don’t have a realistic sense of smell. I feel really discounted by this given that I am miserable in areas the cat has been around.

My husband is seriously the love of my life but this freaking cat seems to come between us. Do I need to just accept the smell of cat pee? Am I being a total jerk keeping her In the basement? title: AITA for insisting the girl in the bookstore wasn't flirting with my boyfriend?
body:
We were in a bookstore, he asked the girl working there for help. We got out of the store together and he told me in passing he was sure the woman had fancied him. I told him "haha I don't believe you". He said that yes, he was sure of it and that her blushing and looking down was very obvious, and that he was certain that if he would've asked her for a drink she would've said yes. I replied "if you say so but I still don't believe you". He said I may not believe it and that I fundamentally think he's ugly but that he's always had a way of seducing women. 


Why I think I'm the asshole: I may have insulted him when I said I didn't believe him. I shouldn't have challenged him. I honestly admit I didn't believe the girl liked him because she was younger and he's older and they had completely different styles. I'm very attracted to my bf but I don't think he's "conventionally" attractive. 


Why I think he's the asshole: what he said kinda hurt and made me feel insecure about us. We're long distance finally hanging out, he was in that bookstore to look for a book for me. I was waiting for him talking to that clerk and when he comes back he says that. He said something later about how I don't need to worry because you don't go from having a little chemistry with someone to instantly sleeping with them and he wasn't interested in her. But this just pissed me off further tbh. I don't mind honesty but...yeah

title: AITA for being mad that a friend suddenly sprung new person joining in on our trip?
body:
So my friends and I (mostly me) have been planning a trip to a music festival for over a month. The person in question, who I'll refer to as D, has backed out before then suddenly wants to go. Ok, fine. I buy the tickets, book the hotel room and work out the fine details.

Cut to 2 days ago, I get told by our mutual friend, G, that they're planning on leaving at 6PM due to work. Ok, cool. I'm annoyed but whatever.  I have family in this town that I want to see, and the only time available is sometime tonight (Friday, day 1 of our trip. I'm in our hotel room waiting for something to happen as I type this). I message our group chat so they know I'm here, we're checked in and their room keys are at the desk in case I'm not here. 

D springs that he's bringing "A friend" (that's literally what he said) not only on me, but G as well. I freaked out because I worked really hard to plan this and don't like sudden changes to plans l I'm keeping this, and don't want to be stuck in the same room as a total stranger. 

D said he's playing his part and it's not a big deal, and doesn't understand why I'm not comfortable with that.

AITA for basically blowing up and telling him that it's not cool for him to spring shit like that on me last minute?

UPDATE AND FOLLOWUP AITA

The weekend went horribly. D treated me like total shit the whole time (complained when I got sick and didn't want to go out (they went out without me), the wait time at a restaurant I suggested, and then called me going to a candy store that sells retro candy to get some for my mom stupid) and G didn't step in and say anything. I ended up hiding in the candy stores bathroom and crying because I was so miserable. 

I decided I was done. Told G that I didn't feel wanted by them and was going home, said bye to him, and drove the 4 hours back to my city. They stayed well into the night and the only times I talked to G was letting him know I was home, and him doing the same. D apparently didn't even realize I was leaving until he saw me walking back towards my car.

I haven't spoken to them since, and I'm kind of refusing to speak to D until he apologizes to me (which part of me knows will never happen) 

AITA for leaving without explaining fully why I felt that way and refusing to speak to them? Neither has reached out to me either.

title: WIBTA For refusing to go to the funeral of someone I've never met?
body:
So, I'm an 18yr old Student whos home for the holidays. My Mum has decided she wants me to attend the funeral of a woman who I've literally never laid eyes on. I (apparently) once met her husband when I was very young but have no recollection of this.

Now, no one else in my family is being sent to this funeral apart from my Aunt who also barely had any connection to these people.

I feel it'd almost be disrespectful for me to just go to this funeral as its really not my time to grieve or anything.

I'd understand if I was going with others in my family who were close to this woman but I'm just being sent as a placeholder for people who knew her.

I have two siblings who are both also at home but aren't being asked to go. Both are older than me and will likley have actual memories of meeting her husband.

Is it heartless of me for not wanting to go?

title: AITA for not taking a friend hunting or fishing anymore?
body: In high school, I had a friend who I used to hunt and fish with quite a bit. We used to go almost every week. While it was fun going outside, this friend made almost everything a dick measuring contest and had a “I’m always right and you’re an asshole attitude.” I put up with it for a while but my other friends didn’t like to go with him very much. When I called him out for his attitude he called me a control freak. This past summer, I got sick of his shtick and stopped inviting him out on trips. I never gave a reason why or had a big confrontation, I just stopped inviting him. I can speak for my other fishing buddies and I in that we are all having a lot more fun without him. However, he’s been texting an old group chat of ours asking if I and my other friends are going to be back in town to go out this thanksgiving break. I simply haven’t responded. AITA for not responding or inviting him?
